answers.answer: It depends on ur body shape

You should be able to be seen straight away if you're concerned..have you eaten less than usual..when I fasted for the diabetes blood test I was worried. I didn't sleep all night as I felt no movements but managed to see the midwives at the centre I was already going to. As soon as I drank the glucose drink as part of the test, baby made her presence known. It was because of the fasting. Don't wait too long x

When ur thinner u feel them sooner then if u have a bit of weight .. Of u lie on ur back and stretch ur legs out and drink cold water and wait a few mins u might start to feel something around ur hip area
With my first pregnancy my daughter would move a lot & it was a lot higher then this pregnancy. All of my first movements for the last few weeks have been at the bottom. Maybe it's a boy!!!!
Baby dosent actually move up until about 21 week into the belly
My doctor told me that the more kids you have you can carry lower. I'm pregnant with my third and it feels like my baby is in my pelvic bone lol. But my doctor said it's normal so I hope that helps.
My doctor told me that the more kids you have you can carry lower. I'm pregnant with my third and it feels like my baby is in my pelvic bone lol. But my doctor said it's normal so I hope that helps.

question: I am almost 18 weeks with second baby and the movements are extremely low is this normal my first child they were higher? Am i the only one dealing with this?
title: 18 weeks
